blogposts.imageCaption: 🍎These are apple seeds I've kept in the fridge inside a zip-lock bag since january. I'll keep them in there for a few more weeks before I plant them!

post: After that last picture was taken ⬇, I went away for a few days. When I got back home, all my peppers and tomatoes looked reeeally sad due to, of course, lack of water!

In a crazy moment where my brain stopped and the love for my plants just exploded and I thought *WATER IS NOT ENOUGH, WATER IS NOT ENOUGH* 🧠🚨💓💥, I gave them what I didn't quite realize was CONCENTRATED fertilizer. ☠️
Previously I've been really careful with this stuff and added maybe something like 2 table spoons in 1.5 liters of water (in case it was concentrated - well I know now)... but not this time.
Can you imagine what happened? Yes, of course they all died! I ended up mourning for a few days before I planted new ones and they started to sprout.
What's really cool tho, is that after I desperately tried to leach the soil of the tomatoes, by advice from the Google, my tomatoes died, but after a few days some new ones showed up! 🌱
Maybe they just needed a fertilizer boost to sprout! They grow fast too.
blogposts.imageCaption: The new tomatoes. 🍅 Look at them! All fresh and happy! 💖
As promised, here are some 🍅plants and code in sweet harmony.

post: Hey everyone, it's officially spring in Norway ☀️🌿🇳🇴, I just got my sunscreen 🧴, I'm ready for summer and here's my new blogish!
When I think of blogs I imagine all these fancy cookies with glaze on them🧁, pink lipsticks💄 and outfit of the day👘, that 's why I couldn't help calling this a blogish.
Don 't get me wrong, I 'm a girl, I like lipstick, but most likely there will be no cookies to find here, and especially not an outfit of the day - but who knows, sometimes I surprise myself.
You might risk bumping into *some* plants here, though!🌱
I love my plants, they 're my babies.
I have new ones born every once in a while, as I plant the babies of everything I eat.
I 'm just too curious about what the mother looked like as a baby to keep myself from letting them outgrow my house. 🏡
Anyplants🌴(I 'm about to grow a palm tree..), I just want to share the things I'm excited about.
I feel pretty confident that this will end up being about my future projects and mainly plants, so I guess I might as well just call it Plants and Codies.
That 's it for now, I'll try to get this thing up and running! But first I want to redo my site, so plz gimme just a tiny piece of patience.
